t: The Lord Is My Strength and My Song
You*pn will say in that day: “I*ln will give thanks to you, O Lord,*s for*ld though you were angry with me, your*ln anger turned away, that*ld you might comfort me.
“Behold,*pn God is my salvation; I*ld will trust, and will not be afraid; for*ln the Lord*s God*s is my strength and my song, and*ld he has become my salvation.”
With*p joy you will draw water from the wells of salvation.
And you will say in that day: “Give*pn thanks to the Lord,*s call*ld upon his name, make*ln known his deeds among the peoples, proclaim*ld that his name is exalted.
“Sing*pn praises to the Lord,*s for he has done gloriously; let*ld this be made known in all the earth.
Shout,*ln and sing for joy, O inhabitant of Zion, for*ld great in your midst is the Holy One of Israel.”
